title: Make the effort to visit now
text:
We wanted to just see the Ancient Greek section, so we booked up a slot. We spent about 90 minutes and it was excellent. Although there were a lot of people it was not so full and you were able to see all the exhibits with time and space.

To visit now is a great experience and helps to keep our cultural life vibrant.

title: Local taverna to our flat
text: It was recommended by our landlady, great sea view, as are most of the restaurants in Parikia in Paros. Busy place with favourful local dishes, service was good, altogether an enjoyable dinner.

title: Interesting museum about the heroine
text: A simple and well preserved museum of this important woman in the fight for independence, especially as the island was the centre of the action.

title: A great walk to it at the far end of town
text:
Recommended as a good place as well as being the oldest restaurant - it was delightful. The various fish dishes were delicious we would suggest you go there without fail.
Very busy with tourists and locals.

title: Moving to finally see it.
text: Finally saw this temple, which is so well known, especially as daily l see the church in Central London, UK, based upon it.

title: Home of the Olympics
text: Located on a main road near the park it is moving to see the home of the Olympics. A vast structure only for sport. The original cathedral to sport.

title: Recently opened Modern Art Museum
text:
The well-funded museum is a marvellous example of a wealthy couples' collection of modern art - some exquiste Van Goghs, Picassos, Degas etc. through to Jackson Pollock and Greek painters.

The museum building is itself an interesting design.

The cafe was a great place to eat, better than the usual museum cafes.

title: See it after the Parthenon
text:
A very modern, beautifully executed museum which recreates the Acropolis. You can study the whole structure within the museum and really appreciate the complexity of the building. The museum is flooded with light and so you can see the details clearly.
The cafe is a good place to take a break.

title: If you have 1 day, you must see the Acropolis
text:
Go early in the morning when it opens, avoid the crowds and breather antiquity. The whole complex was much larger than we anticipated and there was lots to see, notwithstanding the ravages of time and the Venetian bombardments and Elgin's appropriations.

For us the Parthenon was awe-inspiring and so much larger then we expected.

It is really one of the best sights to see in the world

title: Central Venice, good place
text:
From Strada Nuova it seems small but it is long and has a large garden at the back. All the diners were well spaced and most of the tables were taken.

There is a good value lunchtime dinner plus a wide range of pizzas. Roberto has had it for over 30 years l believe. We opted instead for an antipasto di pesce, It was excellent, fresh and varied, it was so satisfying that we decided not to have a primo nor secondo. l had a great semi freddo, freshly prepared.

All in all good value whether you want something simple or more complicated.

title: Good local trattoria
text:
We enjoyed a dish of different pastas, with a couple of fritto misto for the five of us.
The pasta was tasty, but the crab one had some tough bits in it, but otherwise good.
The fritto was good as well.

title: Highest quality all around
text:
The lunchtime meal was excellent, both the starters/ pastas were fine, delicate and flavourful, whilst not being insubstantial. The main courses were superb, I had the fritto, it was light.
The service was very good and the attention was just right.

title: Wonderful garden, spacious feel, good food
text:
A group of ten celebrated a birthday at lunchtime on a sunny day. It was risotto with Gho fish, ice cream and white wine.
Superb

title: Good position, good food
text: We have been a few times and the food is always good. The last time was a very sunny evening for an early meal. The pasta was excellent

title: A completely different Venetian experience
text:
We know the island well and we spent three days there. We stayed at Lato Azzurro and ate at La Bacan, the first is the only place to stay and the latter is the only place to eat. Very simple.

With the free bikes you can discover the island but remember nowhere to eat.

You can enjoy the beach where all the Venetians go in their boats.

It is very busy over the weekends, so you will enjoy it better during the week.

title: Great site, nears some tlc
text:
Ideally situated at Sant Erasmo it is a great setting, but needs to be better maintained to merit a better rating. It was good, not average.

Covid makes life more difficult for the hotel but they cope well.

The rooms were fine, clean and simple.

The breakfast was simple and we only ate one evening as it did not inspire us . We ate at the Bacan nearby.

Free bikes to enjoy the island, all in all good value

title: One of the best Agritourisms in Italy.
text:
The brothers Michele & Gianni plus their wives and children who help make it a wonderful family run place.

The food is excellent and the rooms are always clean and comfortable.

Notwithstanding Covid 19 we found it as good as before. We came by boat so the moorings are fine, either near the farm or in the canal nearby.

We have been annually for about five years and it is consistently good.

title: Not to be missed
text:
A modern building filled with beautiful Ferraris, so even non petrol heads can enjoy it. They really looked like works of art, also interesting to see how the firm has managed to survive in this highly competitive.
Maybe more videos would be interesting.

title: Great place
text: Tucked mainly underground it is a terrific venue with extremely flavourful pizzas, the white painted vaulted dining area gives it a cheerful and friendly atmosphere.

title: Good base for visiting the area
text:
The room was fine, straightforward and clean with attached bathroom. Sleep quality was good.

We had breakfast but we were out during the day and ate out in the evenings so we did not try the restaurant.

It seems to have a lively trade and offers a good base.

title: One night became two, due to Hurricane Dennis
text:
It was due to be the last night before a morning departure but the hurricane cancelled all of the flights so we stayed another night. The hotel is clean and modern, the staff understanding and efficient and capable of handling the extra stress of the hurricane.

The breakfasts were good and the dinner was fine, although you had to bear with them with the full hotel.

Extremely convenient for the airport, a few minutes across the car park.

title: Evening dinner with friends
text: An unusual restaurant, Indian/Icelandic. A large group of us tried many different dishes, we had fish of the day and a vegetable curry which were both very good. Well prepared and tasty, with Gull beer to drink. The total for two was ISK 8950, or £56, which is good for Iceland where dining is at the expensive end.

title: Late afternoon meal
text:
We stopped in this popular cafe in the centre of the city. I had the filling Plokkfiskur, which was a fish based rice dish designed to be an appetite "stopper"

The place is a simple wooden interior without pretension.

Worth a visit

title: Ate in the restaurant
text: We ate here two evenings in a row. A large, spacious restaurant with elegant furniture and fittings. The fish and the lamb were both very good, the desserts were also tempting. The local Viking beer was a good way to relieve the day's travelling.

title: Excellent fish
text:
We arrived for a late lunch, it was busy and the food was fine, as a fishing town the fish was the thing to eat and it was excellent. Well worth waiting for lunch.

Situated near the port with the trawlers, it had to be good!

The restaurant was nicely decorated and welcoming

title: Local bar with great snacks
text: Located in one of the back streets near the Rialto Bridge, we have used it many times and we always enjoy it, good wines, beers, food and even live music some nights. JUst completing a review which I never got around to doing before.

title: Again a dramatic setting
text: Robust structure with a commanding view of the sea. Walking along the beach you are overtaken by the beauty of the place. We stopped for a coffee at the nearby hotel. It would be a great place to stay if you had more time.

title: Extensive Glacier
text:
It was a great impression to see the size and breadth of it, but even more amazing is the fact that it has receded so much in the last 30 years. What hope for the next 30 years?
At times it was a bit difficult with the compacted ice in the shady parts - the day was overcast.

title: Isolated part of the Golden Circle
text: Arriving at the Church after a splendid drive along the coastal road you arrive at this isolated, wind swept but sunny headland. The raw beauty of the place was fine, there were very few tourists which made it even more dramatic

title: Dramatic waterfall
text: On the Golden Circle route out of season was interesting to see the waterfall nestling close to the roads. With the snow on the ground and the roar of the waterfall make it really atmospheric.

title: First time flight
text: From Amsterdam to Reykjavik on a Boeing 777 was a pleasant relaxing trip. Reasonable choice of films and a choice of non alcoholic drinks was fine but they could have pushed the boat to a simple snack for a three and a half flight.

title: Leonardo exhibit
text: Always a pleasure to go there, we heard the curator give a talk about mounting the exhibition. It was interesting but l found that it was difficult to maintain the interest for the whole time. I may not attend future talks of this nature.

title: A Gem of the 1920/30s
text: Set within an apartment block you can really understand and appreciate the style of the times and enjoy the atmosphere

title: Great Japanese in v.Eustachi
text: Four of us had an excellent meal at lunchtime in the restaurant, not the smaller bar one, and we were all pleased with our choices. I love the Katsu Curry, others had 2 Misonikomi Udon and a Taira No Gozen, plus Jasmine tea, 2 beers al for 95,00

title: Luckily it was open on Sunday lunch.
text:
Along with a friend from Modena we wanted to try local Tortellini, with Sorbara Lambrusco, followed by zampone e lentils.
Good wholesome food, extremely tasty and satisfying.
The place is genuine, not remodeled and the service was friendly.
place: Trattoria la Pomposa al Re Gras

title: On the offchance
text:
Although there was a queue we went in and waited only a short time and we had a really enjoyable, well prepared dinner.
The sharing veggie starter, a Pad Thai Veg and a Chicken Penang, tea and a beer. Excellent dinner, cramped seating but not a problem.
Altogether worth a visit.

title: Great place in Kyoto
text:
Well run, friendly and close to transport links, trains and buses.
We would use it again if we return to Kyoto
The breakfasts were good, with Japanese options, which were very good.
It was good to return after a busy day and relax with their special teas

title: New Hotel and Restaurant by Kings Cross
text:
Five of us had an early lunch which was excellent.

We were not staying there but we stopped for an early lunch, we had three starters and four main courses which were all very well-prepared with fine flavours particularly the fish dishes of crab and the river trout.

The dining room was interestingly designed and with many books on display it gives a warm welcoming atmosphere.

title: Good restaurant close to Villa Maser
text:
Five of us stopped for a lunchtime. Attractive interior with a good space between the tables with good service.
The food was very well prepared and the choice was interesting.
Enjoyable lunch.

title: Wonderful villa
text:
It is set in a beautiful hillside, it is well maintained and the frescos are finely restored with great details. The frescos of Veronese, his wife and the servants entering from the side doors.

We did not eat there as it was closed.

title: Good value, efficient
text: They were efficient, although meeting at the airport involved a few mobile phone calls, and were good value for money. The departure was equally efficient and smooth

title: Visit this most wealthy of colleges
text:
The tour was excellent and the guides throughout the buildings were informative. Everyone was impressed by the grandeur and sense of history. Pre purchase your tickets if you can.
We also went to Evensong which was a magical experience with their choir. Obviously there is no charge.

title: An amazing collection of diverse material
text: This respected museum covers a multitude of different cultures from around the world. You should allow at least two hours to visit this museum.

title: Refurbished and still good
text:
Over the last week we have met friends there in Campo SanToma.
It has been tastefully refurbished to a good standard whilst the prices provide good value for a relaxing drink with imaginative cicchetti snacks.

The food looked good but we did not try it.

title: Getting better all the time
text: Have eaten there a few times, we went last week and the food was better than before. The curries were excellent, as were the fafale. The service is good and the restaurant is proving to be very successful, best to book if you have a large group.

title: Superb
text: It has been restored and upgraded into a first class museum with a wide range of exhibits covering art, furniture, objects and a wide range of cultures, European, Chinese and Indian.
place: Ashmolean Museum of Art and Archaeology

title: Discretely located by Madaglen Bridge
text: We did not know that this existed but it was a good place to visit and had a wide range of plants to see, as you expect in a city like Oxford.

title: Excellent venue
text: A large group of us had an enjoyable evening meal there. The choice was limited but the food was good, but the portions and the abundance of courses was on the mean side. They could have been more generous. I wouldn't rush back

title: Great pub in the back streets
text:
Seems like a small tucked away pub but it is a large space, very deceptive.

A large group of us had an evening meal there, the pies were particularly good. There was a good selection of beers to try and the service was swift given how busy it was. Best to book especially for a large group.

Must return another time

title: Small specialised museum
text: Knowing about the boat history in Venice we wanted to visit this museum as it has a special role in the boat building history of Venice. This small village was most important in the making of nails for the city, both small and large. It is well presented and even better if you ask the people there for more information.

title: Superb setting and dinner
text: Our local friends booked it for our first evening there. We cycled through the tunnel to the restaurant. The setting is magnificent and the 7 course menu was an excellent choice, all the dishes were tasty and fresh. The whole evening was most enjoyable, not inexpensive but worthwhile.

title: Best place for foccaccia
text: It is small but has a great range of foccaccia with some quiche type dishes. Excellent place to buy something for lunch. Justifiably well known locally

title: Great position, good food
text:
We walked to the restaurant through the olive groves for a meal about 7.30. It is always busy as it is well known locally. We had a great meal with a local bottle of wine produced in the area.

The meal was fine and the service was good. Well worth a visit.

title: Simple and friendly osteria
text:
After a film nearby we decided to have a single course, there were six of us and we all chose different dishes. They were straightforward and enjoyable. The waitress was efficient and friendly.
It is always busy with both locals and tourists.

title: Clean, modern hotel close to the Romea
text:
We rowed to the area from Venice, moored nearby and stayed here for the evening, nice hot showers and a simple meal. A good night's sleep followed by a buffet breakfast.
The rooms were modern and clean.
Nearby there is an excellent WWF site which merits a visit.

title: Great pub
text:
Great atmosphere, good beer and good food.
Perfect place to stop for a passing drink or to eat something.

title: Staying in an Oxford College
text:
A group of 10 of us stayed in this beautiful college for a week whilst rowing in the city. The most perfect 1610 quad with a wonderful dining hall where you have breakfast, made it another magical experience.
The staff were friendly and helpful when asked.

title: Beware of long lines for departure to non Schengan destination
text: The line for non Italian passport holders was VERY long. About 1 person in the Italian passport holders line and 100 in the NON ITALIAN passport holders line!!!!
place: Venice Marco Polo Airport Link Departure Transfer

title: Best pizza in the City
text:
Simply well made, good choice and good value.
We bought enough for 20 people which we took home. We were all well satisfied.

title: Wonderful villa
text:
It is set in a beautiful hillside, it is well maintained and the frescos are finely restored with great details. The frescos of Veronese, his wife and the servants entering from the side doors.

We did not eat there as it was closed.

title: Good value, efficient
text: They were efficient, although meeting at the airport involved a few mobile phone calls, and were good value for money. The departure was equally efficient and smooth

title: Visit this most wealthy of colleges
text:
The tour was excellent and the guides throughout the buildings were informative. Everyone was impressed by the grandeur and sense of history. Pre purchase your tickets if you can.
We also went to Evensong which was a magical experience with their choir. Obviously there is no charge.

text: This respected museum covers a multitude of different cultures from around the world. You should allow at least two hours to visit this museum.

It has been tastefully refurbished to a good standard whilst the prices provide good value for a relaxing drink with imaginative cicchetti snacks.

The food looked good but we did not try it.

text: Have eaten there a few times, we went last week and the food was better than before. The curries were excellent, as were the fafale. The service is good and the restaurant is proving to be very successful, best to book if you have a large group.

text: It has been restored and upgraded into a first class museum with a wide range of exhibits covering art, furniture, objects and a wide range of cultures, European, Chinese and Indian.

A large group of us had an evening meal there, the pies were particularly good. There was a good selection of beers to try and the service was swift given how busy it was. Best to book especially for a large group.

Must return another time

text: It is small but has a great range of foccaccia with some quiche type dishes. Excellent place to buy something for lunch. Justifiably well known locally

text:
We walked to the restaurant through the olive groves for a meal about 7.30. It is always busy as it is well known locally. We had a great meal with a local bottle of wine produced in the area.

The meal was fine and the service was good. Well worth a visit.

text:
After a film nearby we decided to have a single course, there were six of us and we all chose different dishes. They were straightforward and enjoyable. The waitress was efficient and friendly.
It is always busy with both locals and tourists.

text:
We rowed to the area from Venice, moored nearby and stayed here for the evening, nice hot showers and a simple meal. A good night's sleep followed by a buffet breakfast.
The rooms were modern and clean.
Nearby there is an excellent WWF site which merits a visit.

title: Great pub
text:
Great atmosphere, good beer and good food.
Perfect place to stop for a passing drink or to eat something.

title: Staying in an Oxford College
text:
A group of 10 of us stayed in this beautiful college for a week whilst rowing in the city. The most perfect 1610 quad with a wonderful dining hall where you have breakfast, made it another magical experience.
The staff were friendly and helpful when asked.

title: Beware of long lines for departure to non Schengan destination
text: The line for non Italian passport holders was VERY long. About 1 person in the Italian passport holders line and 100 in the NON ITALIAN passport holders line!!!!
place: Venice Marco Polo Airport Link Departure Transfer

title: Best pizza in the City
text:
Simply well made, good choice and good value.
We bought enough for 20 people which we took home. We were all well satisfied.

title: Guggenheim museum
text:
The museum is still a wonderful experience, it is like visiting a private home with a great art collection.
The Bracuzzi is superb.

title: Excellent restoration
text:
The old Victorian prison and later additions has been made into a museum, art gallery and eating space.

Beautifully executed, you can easily spend a few hours visiting the complex.

They need to have some video films running to explain the complex evolvement.

title: Good hotel, with roof terrace.
text:
The hotel is clean, the staff helpful and is good value for money. It has one floor underground which may not suit everyone.

The roof terrace is great fun for a meal or a drink with the Taj in the distance.

Like many hotels they are good, or above average, but TP does not have a good category, only average or very good!

title: Enjoyable meal after a long day
text: Our guide recommended it and we were not disappointed. The meal was well presented and well prepared. Spicy but not mouth blowing, even had a beer, which was unusual for the area.

title: Great place
text:
Wonderful place, quaintly styled with a colonial appearance with a colourful and well kept garden.
Enjoyed it immensely, the trekking and food demo added to the pleasurable experience.

The food was good also, as we ate there for the nights we stayed there.

title: Newly decorated friendly hotel
text:
Although situated a bit out of town without shops nearby it offers a clean large room with a pleasant Restaurant on the top floor.
As with all of the city you need to allow time moving between places.

title: Excellent
text:
The guided tour was great, the walkway in the sky was fun and the content interesting.

They deserve to do well.

title: Seemed a good idea at the time.
text:
A bit of a non event as the boat was full, including a few unhappy kids who were crying most of the time.
It was a sunny day and the lake was pretty but we saw hardly any animals and as we had seen other safaris in other countries this was a bit of a waste of time.

title: Georgian in Chennai
text:
This splendid and well maintained building is an oasis of peace in the hectic Chennai traffic.

On a Sunday morning after the services with all the doors open the sense of beauty and space were wonderful.

Reading the tomb tablets you can follow the British from 1815 to today. People died of illness, assassinations, war or just old age. The adejacent graveyard reinforces this image.

It sits in its own extensive grounds next door to the world's current important power, the US consulate.

It reminded me greatly of St.Martins in the Field in London UK.

title: Enjoyable and informative
text:
We went as it was well recommended and it was worthwhile. Between the owner and his no.2 we had a long and interesting guided tour around the plantation.

They explain the types and uses of the various spices and highlight the importance of them for medicine both now and on the future

The high walk was great.

A range of spices can be bought there, but we bought little as we had already done our buying, but even so they deserve your custom.

title: Excellent seafood
text:
Five of us had a stunning fish meal, tiger prawns in a spicy sauce, fish in banana leaf, various curries, rice etc.

Modern decor complements the experience.

Valet parking to make it easy.

title: Sleeping in the sky
text:
This unusual hotel is eco friendly with bungalows raised about 4 metres off the ground. They are simply furnished but quite sufficient.

There are about 6 units set in a tropical forest with many different varieties of plants, about 85 if l remember. The owner is a forestry specialist who is passionate about his project.

You eat in a central point and the owner's mother, who is a lovely person, prepares all the meals with a helper and they are good south Indian dishes.

It is an imaginative project and every visitor helps it to succeed.

Make sure that you get the directions from them as Google takes you down impossible roads which leave you 150 metres from your destination!

Some simple maintenance on the bungalows needs to be regularly carried out to maintain standards.

title: Notable setting
text:
The five temples are very beautiful set in a tranquil setting. The elephant is really exquisite.
When we went there were not many people, but l imagine that it can be very busy in the season.

title: Hardly any people!
text:
We took the crowded ferry (2 rupees!) from Fort Cochin to the terminal and after walking 5 minutes there was no one around. We went to the small museum about the creation of the island by reclamation in the 1930s by an English engineer. Old black and white photos, best for engineers, but if you are there drop in to see it.
Then another ferry ride to the mainland, again 2 rupees.

title: Fish market
text:
Lovely colourful market by the fishing boats hauled onto the beach.

A wide selection of fish, with some enormous prawns.

Such a shame that we were not in a self catering place!

title: Elegantly laid out
text:
We stayed upstairs in this colonial style hotel and enjoyed the spacious room with a good shower. The
rooms become warm swiftly so the air conditioning is a real benefit along with the fan. Beds are hard but that is not a problem for us.

The dining area is downstairs and easy to reach. I particularly liked the terrace outside the room for reading.

Staff were helpful.

title: Impressive temple
text:
This temple stands on the headland within its own grassy enclosure, it dominates the area.

It is being maintained well and deserves a good visit to appreciate its beauty.

title: Fascinating number of temples
text:
We visited four temples all of which had different characters. One was immaculate, one run down, one very grand and the sandstone one beautifully located more out of town.

Well worth the visits, very few westerners made the visit.

title: Great museum
text:
This museum explains southern India by having dismantled and re-erected the buildings on this site. By having examples of a Tamil, Hindu, Christian and Muslim house along with existing weavers houses it really becomes a living museum and you can understand the lives of the people.

Given the time it takes on the busy roads this enables you to enjoy the richness of the culture without suffering the road traffic.

We did not try the restaurant but it looked okay.

title: Could be very good
text:
Situated in the old government building by the prime minister's office it offers a glimpse into the English era in Madras.
Established when artifacts could be displayed with a brief name of the item, we have moved on a good video talking about the time would help a lot.
The 18th century prints of arriving and embarking at Madras were really fascinating.
Even though foreigners pay 250 and locals only 30, there were hardly any visitors.
A museum to see if you are in the area if you want to know more of the period.

title: Superb
text:
A late lunch was taken of poppadom platter, kabab, gosht dum and murg biryani, with malai kulfi & muzzafar.
For 5 of a reasonable 4,200

title: Remarkable Botanic Gardens
text:
Having lived opposite Kew Gardens in London we are used to a high standard, Peradeniya was up to this standard.
Well organised, an interesting selection exhibits, orchid house, fernery,bamboos, plant house and my favourite the palm avenues.
Towards the end of the day, as usual, there was a thunderstorm...

title: World renowned
text:
The grandeur of the buildings with the inner sanctum is an impression.
Upon entering the main temple an elderly man gave us a good guided tour which explained a lot to us. He obviously requested a donation which we happily gave him.
As a major site for pilgrims it was very busy.
place: Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic

title: Seems a bit run down
text:
From the approach it looks uninteresting, but once inside it has been well done.
The building has been well restored and the machinery looks as if it could work today.
We found it amazing the fortunes which were made and the role of Sir Thomas Lipton with James Taylor in creating a world industry in the late 1800s.
They must paint at least the sign at the entrance.
An explanatory video would be good.

title: Always makes a marvellous impression
text:
Although there is scaffolding over one half of the interior it is awe-inspiring and the restoration is being done well.
There is a useful video at the entrance, a bit tucked away.
Then up to the gallery which gives this amazing view of one of the greatest buildings in the world.
The mosaics are unlike anyway else.
Allow time to visit it.

title: Centrally located, great hotel
text:
The rooms are grand and spacious, some new paintwork would add to it.
An excellent roof restaurant where breakfast is served with great views of the city.
There is an excellent restaurant in the basement which the desk staff do not mention! We wandered down on our last night to discover it, very busy even mid week.

title: Classic colonial hotel
text:
Full of charm but looking tired after its long life.
We only stopped for a beer and a snack which was fine in the pleasant bar area. Next time would like to try their luncheon in a fine dining room.
Only problem was getting the waiter to pay attention to present the bill by being distracted.

title: Fine development on the lake
text:
We stayed only one evening before doing a safari, but we enjoyed the setting, the pool and the dinner.
When travelling we like to eat local food and the menu was very western which was disappointing, but all four of us chose the curries which were good, they even replenished our various dishes.
Friendly staff.

title: Historic battlements
text: The city has been well restored with a fine walk along the battlements and then an interesting walk through the old streets to the old hospital and fortified entrance tower.
place: Old Town of Galle and its Fortifications

title: Great hotel in Galle
text:
Beautifully and sympathically restored and managed well with Kirk the owner and his team.
The location is ideal.
Upon arrival there was a mal-allocation of a room but it was resolved by a couple being upgraded to the King suite.
The breakfast was very good.
The small terrace allows a good view of life in the town.

title: Eyeextraordinary!
text:
Really amazing venue.

The number of rooms are limited but very much a wonderful assault on the eyes.

Commentaries every half an hour are quite interesting but the guides rush through their presentations and the accoustics are not the best.

The greenhouse at the end of the visit is also a surprise.

title: Good location
text:
We ate here early evening with the sun shining. The food was tasty and wholesome but l would say the the description in the menu was better than the product. The prawns were fine, the chowder appetising but the large fish grill was limited, some salmon and crab cakes with too much sauce, swamping the fish.

However, a satisfying meal.

title: Splendid location
text:
A large, impressive hotel on the headland with an informal and pleasant staff, particularly the head concierge, Dillon.

The well appointed rooms are complemented by the pool and mineral baths, making it an attractive venue.

It is extremely disappointing that breakfast is not included in the room rate which is high, especially when a large group had booked. That is a question the management should seriously
consider as most of us were of the same impression.

title: Fulsome Brunch
text:
Someone had suggested that this would be a good idea for a Sunday brunch and they were correct. There were no tables available so like others we had to wait, but it was worth it.

An English full breakfast and a hash breakfast were chosen, l believe that the full English was the better choice but both were fine choices.

Make a date for the Brunch...

title: Enlightening tour
text:
Enlightening tour by Don, through Government St to Chinatown we understood and saw so much of old downtown Victoria.

You must do a visit with them

title: Unexpectedly good museum
text:
Somehow you do not associate a ski resort with a good museum. This interesting design holds a gem of a museum dedicated to the First Nations.

The guides transmit their passion for their heritage. The exhibits - canoes, blankets, basketwork are all well displayed
Even the local Bannock bread can be tried in the cafe, which was good value.

At the museum you cannot buy the discounted two museum ticket for Audain and Squamish at the museums, only at the Tourist Office.

title: After a long flight
text:
We asked a friend for a good local place to eat and she suggested here.
It was a sunny evening eating outside.

The food and service were good, interesting dishes, served with an interest in the offerings.

A good intro to Vancouver

title: Off the tourist track
text:
Local friends said we'll meet you there. A range of Indian & Middle Eastern selection of dishes, all interesting.

Two of us had the Tasting menu which was copius and satisfying, some choose a lesser number of dishes.

Unhurried and friendly service

title: Amazingly good vegetarian restaurant
text:
Located away from the centre, it is used by the locals and you have to await your table.

It is well worth it, the starters and mains were delicious and we even tried desserts with extra spoons.

We were suitably impressed and enjoyed the locality.

title: Well known - justifiedly
text:
Wishing to try some of Vancouver's Chinese heritage we decided upon Dynasty. It is so popular you have to wait in line.
Once seated it was worth waiting for.
The Crab claw starters were fine, the Scallop & Prawn, Chicken and Dynasty fried rice were fine. Generous portions were the norm.
